sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Yasuchika later became an architect, and when he joined the construction of the Imperial Hotel, he gained the favor of Frank Lloyd Wright, who was the designer of the hotel.
sen.cmt: 頭からの読み下しで理解しやすくするため、「建築家になった」「参加した」「可愛がられた」という順序に、文章を再構成しました。文法的な理由で、Frank Lloyd Wrightの後のwhoの前にコンマを入れました。リズムがより自然かと思われましたので、"who designed"を"who was the designer of"に変更しました。
sen.e: Yasuchika later became an architect, and when he joined the construction of the Imperial Hotel, he gained the favor of Frank Lloyd Wright, who was the designer of the hotel.

sen.j: 泰親は子母澤寛との親交が深く、子母澤の新選組関連著作の創作部分に登場する。
sen.e: Yasuchika had deep friendship with Kan SHIMOZAWA and was often mentioned in fiction in books about Shinsengumi written by Shimozawa.
Yasuchika had a deep friendship with Kan SHIMOZAWA and appears in fictional parts in Shimozawa's books about Shinsengumi.
sen.cmt: friendshipは可算名詞なのでaを加えました。ストーリーに「登場する」ので、mentionをappearに変更し、時制を現在形にしました。訳文に"often"とありますが、原文では該当する語が見当たりませんので、削除しました。原文の「創作部分」は一箇所とは限らないため、"fiction"を"fictional parts"に変更しました。"in books"に所有格が必要ですので"in Shimozawa's books"と変更しました。それにより、"written by Shimozawa"を削除しました。
sen.e: Yasuchika had a deep friendship with Kan SHIMOZAWA and appears in fictional parts in Shimozawa's books about Shinsengumi.

sen.j: 父元助は入婿で、旧姓が秦である。
sen.e: Tainoshin's father, Gensuke married into his wife's family, and his former family name was Hata.
Gensuke, Tainoshin's father, married into his wife's family, and his former family name was Hata.
sen.cmt: 訳文ではGensukeとTainoshin's fatherが同格であることが一見わかり難いため、Gensukeを主語に出し、Tainoshin's fatherを挿入句に変更しました。
sen.e: Gensuke, Tainoshin's father, married into his wife's family, and his former family name was Hata.

sen.j: 維新後の篠原は、伊東一派の新選組加盟の目的を、新選組を勤王に衣替えするためだったと語っている。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, Shinohara said that the Ito group joined Shinsengumi to make Shinsengumi change into loyalists to the Emperor.
After the Meiji Restoration, Shinohara said that the Ito group joined Shinsengumi to make Shinsengumi change into loyalists to the Emperor.
After the Meiji Restoration, Shinohara said that the Ito group joined Shinsengumi to make Shinsengumi change into loyalists to the Emperor.

sen.j: 近藤は「徳川あっての今日だ」と言って聞き入れなかったと書き残している。
sen.e: Kondo refused to do so, saying "There is no today without Tokugawa," he wrote.
Kondo refused to do so, saying "There is no today without Tokugawa," he wrote.
Kondo refused to do so, saying "There is no today without Tokugawa," he wrote.

sen.j: 御陵衛士拝命は、篠原の尽力であったとされる。
sen.e: It is said that the Goryo-eiji received an official appointment due to Shinohara's effort.
It is said that the Goryo-eji received an official appointment due to Shinohara's effort.
sen.cmt: Goryo-eijiとなっていましたので、iを1つ削除しました。
sen.e: It is said that the Goryo-eji received an official appointment due to Shinohara's effort.

sen.j: 篠原の神奈川奉行所勤務は、窪田が神奈川奉行所取締役に就任したことによる。
sen.e: Thanks to Kubota taking office as the head, Shinohara worked for the Kanagawa Magistrate's office.
Thanks to Kubota taking office as the head, Shinohara worked for the Kanagawa Magistrate's office.
Thanks to Kubota taking office as the head, Shinohara worked for the Kanagawa Magistrate's office.

sen.j: 上京後の伊東らは新選組には即座に加盟せず。
sen.e: Ito and the other members did not join Shinsengumi soon after going up to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Ito and the other members did not join Shinsengumi soon after going up to Kyoto.
Ito and the other members did not join Shinsengumi soon after going up to Kyoto.

sen.j: 大坂の谷万太郎道場に滞在するなど京坂を見学した後、1865年にいたって加盟している。
sen.e: Before joining Shinsengumi in 1865, they stayed in the Mantaro TANI dojo (hall used for martial arts training) and visited Kyoto and Osaka.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Before joining Shinsengumi in 1865, they stayed at the Mantaro TANI dojo (a hall used for martial arts training) and visited places in Kyoto and Osaka.
sen.cmt: 文法的な理由で、"stayed in"を"stayed at"に変更しました。"hall"は可算名詞ですので不定冠詞"a"を追加しました。谷万太郎道場も大坂にあり、原文では「～など京坂を見学した」とありますので、原文の意味をより忠実に反映させるために、"and visited Kyoto and Osaka"を"and visited places in Kyoto and Osaka"と変更しました。
sen.e: Before joining Shinsengumi in 1865, they stayed at the Mantaro TANI dojo (a hall used for martial arts training) and visited places in Kyoto and Osaka.
